Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 3D structured FLTCs; Ultramicroporous; Compact crystal structure with channels facilitating multi-directional Li+ transport

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Physical size exclusion by pore aperture; Immobilization by high density of In3+ on the MOF surface, preventing migration.

Other Information.Additional Info: Pore size (6.5 Å) is smaller than TFSI−(7.9 Å), effectively filtering it out.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Facilitated diffusion and barrier-free ion hopping through 3D fast Li+ conduction network formed by high-density lattice oxygen, enabled by Li+ coordination with lattice oxygen.

Other Information.Additional Info: Exceptional high lattice oxygen density (19.97 nm−3) promotes fast Li+ transport.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion by pore aperture; Ineffective in adsorption due to pore size.

Other Information.Additional Info: Pore structure is sized to isolate DME molecules.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Passage through pore aperture, providing an unobstructed transport channel for Li+ solvation.

Other Information.Additional Info: Pore structure allows only PC molecules and Li+ to enter, acting as a single-ion conductor.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on pore aperture for anion exclusion; Size-selective ion transport of Li+ and PC; Fast Li+ conduction via lattice oxygen network.

Experimental Validation.Method: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS); DC polarization and AC impedance measurement (for tLi+); X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS); 7Li Solid-State Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (ss-NMR); Fourier-transform Infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy; Energy Dispersive Spectroscopy (EDS) analysis; Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations; Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM); Rate performance tests; Cycling performance tests.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ conductivity: 1.11 × 10−3 S cm−1 at 30 °C; Li+ transference number (tLi+): 0.54; Ion transfer activation energy (Ea): 0.204 eV; Superior electrochemical performance in LiFePO4||Li cells (95.2% capacity retention after 1800 cycles at 10 C).

Other Information.Additional Info: Optimal balance between physical size exclusion and chemical mediation of ion transport; Highest lattice oxygen number bulk density (19.97 nm−3); Used in composite solid polymer electrolytes for fast-charging quasi-solid-state lithium metal batteries.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Free migration due to large pore size (10 Å > 7.9 Å); Immobilization by metal centers is insufficient to prevent migration.

Other Information.Additional Info: Large pore structure provides a suitable path for TFSI−movement, leading to decreased tLi+ and inhomogeneous SEI formation.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Ion transport through FLTCs, but significantly hindered by competitive adsorption of other species and the presence of migrating anions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Li+ conductivity: 7.94 × 10−4 S cm−1; Li+ transference number (tLi+): 0.32.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Free access due to large pore size; Adsorbed DME can hinder Li+ transport.
Free access due to large pore size.

Sieving Mechanism: Ineffective molecular sieving due to large pore size, allowing free anion migration; Ion transport hindered by competitive adsorption of solvent molecules and free anion movement.

Experimental Validation.Method: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS); TGA; X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS); Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM); Rate performance tests; Cycling performance tests.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ conductivity: 7.94 × 10−4 S cm−1 at 30 °C; Li+ transference number (tLi+): 0.32; Ion transfer activation energy (Ea): 0.234 eV; Significant reduction in specific capacity after 500 cycles in LiFePO4||Li cells.

Other Information.Additional Info: Lattice oxygen number bulk density: 13.37 nm−3; Used in composite solid polymer electrolytes for lithium metal batteries.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Free migration due to very large pore size (18.2 Å >> 7.9 Å); Immobilization by metal centers is insufficient to prevent migration.

Other Information.Additional Info: Large pore structure provides a suitable path for TFSI−movement, leading to decreased tLi+ and inhomogeneous SEI formation.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Ion transport through FLTCs, but significantly hindered by competitive adsorption of other species and the presence of migrating anions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Li+ conductivity: 9.43 × 10−4 S cm−1; Li+ transference number (tLi+): 0.36.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Free access due to large pore size; Adsorbed DME can hinder Li+ transport.
Free access due to large pore size.

Sieving Mechanism: Ineffective molecular sieving due to very large pore size, allowing significant anion migration; Ion transport hindered by competitive adsorption of solvent molecules and free anion movement.

Experimental Validation.Method: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS); TGA; X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS); Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM); Rate performance tests; Cycling performance tests.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ conductivity: 9.43 × 10−4 S cm−1 at 30 °C; Li+ transference number (tLi+): 0.36; Ion transfer activation energy (Ea): 0.205 eV; Significant reduction in specific capacity after 500 cycles in LiFePO4||Li cells.

Other Information.Additional Info: Lattice oxygen number bulk density: 9.97 nm−3; Used in composite solid polymer electrolytes for lithium metal batteries.
